translation.en: [man] Me too. I've never seen him this upset.
translation.de: Ja. Er war noch nie so aufgebracht.

translation.en: -[woman] I know. -[man] He's taking it hard.
[woman] You know what he said to me?
He said he'll never write another story ever again.
I'm gonna burn all this stupid stuff!
[woman] I'm so afraid that tonight is gonna, like, stifle him or be this wound that haunts him.
translation.de: Ich habe Angst, dass dieser Abend ihn verfolgen wird.

translation.en: [man] He's a creative kid, but maybe we let his obsession with horror get out of hand.
translation.de: Er ist kreativ, aber vielleicht mag er Horror zu sehr.

translation.en: [man] I guess I can see how they could consider it a little weird.
translation.de: Ich verstehe, dass sie das seltsam finden.

translation.en: Maybe it would be easier if he was just more, I don't know, normal.
translation.de: Vielleicht wäre es einfacher, wenn er normal wäre.

translation.en: [man 1 on TV] It was all gonna be so perfect, Lucy…
[man 1 on TV] …just like one big, happy family.
[boy on TV] Great. The bloodsucking Brady Bunch.
[man 1 on TV] I haven't changed my mind about that.
[man 2 on TV] I didn't invite you this time, Max. [Lucy] Michael.
-[boy] Don't you touch my mother! -[Lucy] Sam, don't! No, Sam!
Let's get this over with. I'm a busy witch. Are you useful in any way?
translation.de: Ich bin eine beschäftigte Hexe. Bist du nützlich?

translation.en: they were not useful to me.
Is there anything special about you at all?
translation.de: Kannst du irgendwas Besonderes, das ein Grund sein könnte,

translation.en: Any reason I should let you live?
My Nightbooks. It's where I wrote my stories.
translation.de: Meine Nightbooks. In die schreibe ich.

translation.en: What are you doing with these so late at night?
translation.de: Was machst du so spät damit?

translation.en: I was gonna burn them in the boiler room downstairs.
Burn them? So they're not any good.
They're good. They're very, really, really good.
The title better not be the scariest thing about them. I'm going to need a story every night.
translation.de: Die Geschichten sind hoffentlich gruselig. Ich brauche jeden Abend eine.

translation.en: The story better be good, and it better be scary,
translation.de: Sie sollte gut und gruselig sein.

translation.en: or it's the last thing you'll ever do. [giggles]
translation.de: Sonst war es das für dich.

translation.en: How'd you get in here? -[hissing] -[Alex screaming]
[Alex] And where'd the front door go?
Oh my God. You scared me.
translation.de: Oh mein Gott. Du hast mich erschreckt.

translation.en: -[Alex] You're a kid. -[girl] And you're a genius.
translation.de: -Du bist ein Kind. -Und du ein Genie.

translation.en: Hope you like peanut butter. I used to.
translation.de: Magst du Erdnussbutter? Ich nicht mehr.

translation.en: Anything in these cabinets is off-limits.
Don't ever think Natacha won't miss this piece of popcorn.
-Lenore tells her everything. -[Lenore growls] Come out, you evil skin-bag.
translation.de: Lenore sagt ihr alles. Zeig dich, du Hautlappen.

translation.en: [Alex] And that's the invisible cat? You say cat. I say Natacha's little spy-beast.
translation.de: -Das ist die unsichtbare Katze? -Eher Natachas Spion.

translation.en: Keep up. Natacha is the witch.
Lenore is that wrinkled, hairless thing that follows you around all day, popping up out of nowhere.
translation.de: Lenore ist das haarlose Ding, das dir folgt und einfach auftaucht.

translation.en: She ratted me out over a stinking cup of noodles. I hate that cat.
translation.de: Sie verpetzte mich wegen Nudeln. Ich hasse sie.

translation.en: Don't just stand there. Help me clean this up before Natacha gets home.
I don't know where she goes or what she does, but she can go anywhere she wants.
translation.de: Keine Ahnung, aber sie kann überallhin.

translation.en: Talk about the ultimate passport, this apartment is it.
translation.de: Diese Wohnung ist der ultimative Pass.

translation.en: Come on. We both have work to do. I'll get you set up.
The apartment travels all over the world, luring kids in.
translation.de: Die Wohnung reist um die Welt und lockt Kinder an.

translation.en: I live in Washington. Washington, DC.
I wonder if we're still in Brooklyn. The apartment moves?
translation.de: -Ob wir noch in New York sind? -Sie bewegt sich?

translation.en: The apartment can do two things.
It lures suckers like us in,
and it has room to hold…
The Empty Classroom and Other Creepy Stories.
I thought you said you weren't into that kinda stuff anymore.
translation.de: Ich dachte, du magst so was nicht.

translation.en: -I'm not. It's my friend. -Oh, it's your friend?
He, uh… he'd like all this stuff.
-He's, like… he's really lame. -Yeah, he sounds lame.

translation.de: Okay. Ich soll ihr jeden Abend

translation.en: So she makes me read her a stupid scary story every night,
translation.de: Okay. Ich soll ihr jeden Abend eine Gruselgeschichte vorlesen.

translation.en: but she says everything in here's already been read.
She needs you, so get to work.
You heard her. She wants a scary story tonight.
Every day, write as many stories as you can.
I don't write-- Cut the crap.
I heard you last night, talking about your Nightbook thingies.
translation.de: Ich habe das über die Nightbooks gehört.

translation.en: I'm over the whole writing thing.
Then you better get over getting over it and crank out some new tales, 'cause if you don't--
translation.de: Fang lieber wieder an und überleg dir Geschichten, sonst…

translation.en: You'll be lucky if she kills you.
Forget your family. Forget your friends. Focus on being useful to Natacha.
translation.de: Vergiss deine Familie und Freunde. Sei nützlich für Natacha.

translation.en: Hmm. Were you purposely making me wait?
translation.de: Hast du mich absichtlich warten lassen?

translation.en: -No. I… I was doing the dishes. -Sit there.
Give me a minute to get settled.
Do you know what happens to children who ask too many questions?
translation.de: Weißt du, was mit neugierigen Kindern passiert?

translation.en: Yasmin, too, had a little rebellious streak.
But I am curious about one thing.

translation.de: Warum wolltest du deine Geschichten verbrennen?

translation.en: [Alex] "When… when Todd's best friend Jenny died, his heart shattered into a thousand pieces."
translation.de: "Als Todds Freundin Jenny starb, brach ihm das das Herz."

translation.en: Shattered heart? I like it already.
[Alex] "Everyone avoided the Foster Playground at night."
"They all knew the legend." "In the hour before daylight, the dead kids would come out and play."
translation.de: Sie kennen die Legende der toten Kinder, die rauskommen…"

translation.en: Nope. No, no, no. Sorry, nope.
Everyone knows that ghosts haunt places that are personal to them,
translation.de: Geister suchen Orte heim, die ihnen etwas bedeuten,

translation.en: [Alex] "Todd walks to the playground. He gets to the gate."
"And as soon as his foot crosses the threshold,
"Suddenly, a boy shoots out of the slide."
translation.de: Er sieht einen Jungen an der Rutsche.

translation.en: "Maybe he's ten or so, dressed like a newsie from the '20s."
translation.de: Er mag zehn sein, doch seine Kleidung ist aus den 20ern."

translation.en: Rude. You could at least say hi.
I… I mean… I mean hi.
I'm looking for my friend, Jenny. [Alex] "…Todd says, while looking for any sign of her."
translation.de: -Ich suche meine Freundin. -"Sagt er und sucht nach ihr."

translation.en: To find her, you have to play.
[Alex] "The newsie whistles, and half a dozen dead kids surround Todd."
translation.de: "Der Junge pfeift, und tote Kinder umzingeln Todd.

translation.en: "Their skin is deathly white. Some of their clothes date back decades."
translation.de: Ihre Haut ist kreideweiß. Einige tragen uralte Kleider.

translation.en: "They push Todd on a swing, higher and higher--"
Everyone knows ghosts don't have actual physical hands,
so they could never push him on a swing.
The playground is… it's an interdimensional plane,
a mix between the spirit world and the real world.
Oh, so you're a quantum physicist now?
[hesitates] "And then the children laugh, and they pull Todd to a rusty merry-go-round."
translation.de: "Die Kinder lachen und ziehen Todd zu einem Karussell.

translation.en: "They spin him around and around, faster and faster,
"Then the ghosts force Todd onto a seesaw."
translation.de: Sie zwingen Todd auf eine Wippe.

translation.en: "He holds on tight." "Suddenly, Todd realizes what they're up to."
translation.de: Plötzlich merkt er, was sie vorhaben.

translation.en: "Any living child still on the playground when the sun rises
translation.de: Ist ein lebendes Kind bei Sonnenaufgang noch dort,

translation.en: is cursed to remain there forever."
translation.de: bleibt es für immer auf dem Spielplatz.

translation.en: "He stumbles towards the gate, desperate to get out,
but his world is spinning, and he's tripping over his own feet."
translation.de: aber alles dreht sich, und er stolpert.

translation.en: "The sun's almost up. He's nearly out of time."
"All the ghost children watch in suspense."
"Until suddenly, someone grabs him and pulls him towards the exit."
translation.de: Doch dann zieht ihn jemand zum Ausgang.

translation.en: "'Jenny, I… I wanted to see you.'"
"'Get out of here,' Jenny says, not stopping for a happy reunion."
translation.de: 'Verschwinde', sagt sie und bleibt auf Abstand.

translation.en: "Seeing his old friend again makes Todd's heart hurt."
translation.de: Seine Freundin zu sehen, schmerzt Todd."

translation.en: I miss you. I don't wanna let you go.
translation.de: Ich will dich nicht gehen lassen.

translation.en: [Alex] "But in death, Jenny discovered something that Todd is about to learn."
translation.de: "Doch durch den Tod lernte Jenny etwas Wichtiges."

translation.en: -[meows] -[distorted] Are you out of your mind?
Jenny… Jenny's dead. She's… she's trapped on the playground forever.
translation.de: Jenny ist tot und dort gefangen.

translation.en: -It's not happy for her. -[Natacha breathing heavily]
[spluttering] Ghostly hands go on Todd's back.
He… he… he glances behind him, and he's pulled into the playground.
translation.de: Er blickt hinter sich und wird auf den Spielplatz gezogen.

translation.en: He… he screams for help, but it's no use.
His ghostly soul is trapped there to this very day.
translation.de: Noch heute ist seine Geisterseele dort.

translation.en: [breathlessly] Happy endings are a dangerous thing.
Did you at least like the story? I mean, until the ending?
translation.de: Mochtest du die Geschichte? Bis auf das Ende?

translation.en: This beautiful darkness dances inside your brain.
translation.de: Diese schöne Dunkelheit tanzt in deinem Gehirn.

translation.en: [sighs] I… I wanna be like everyone else.
Uh, I had… I had trouble writing today.
It's just hard to concentrate with someone staring at me all day.
translation.de: Schreiben ist schwer, wenn man angestarrt wird.

translation.en: I told you, show him the library and then get out.
translation.de: Du solltest ihm die Bibliothek zeigen und gehen!

translation.en: -[meows] -It is very important that he writes.
translation.de: Es ist sehr wichtig, dass er schreibt.

translation.en: You know how important it is.
translation.de: Du weißt, wie wichtig es ist.

translation.en: It… it wasn't her fault either.
Well, if it wasn't Yasmin's fault, and it wasn't Lenore's fault,
translation.de: Wenn es nicht Yasmin und Lenore waren,

translation.en: I wasn't trying to get you in any kind of trouble.
Yasmin, I'm sorry. I didn't know about the "no happy endings" thing.
translation.de: Tut mir leid. Das mit den Happy Ends wusste ich nicht.

translation.en: Todd shouldn't have gone back for Jenny.
He was her friend, and that's what friends do.
But in here? She's right, you know.
She wants stories? Fine. I'll give her some stories.
translation.de: Sie will Geschichten? Dann bekommt sie welche.

translation.en: Haunted by the spirit of somebody who died working at it.
translation.de: Heimgesucht vom Geist, der daran saß.

translation.en: No, no, it's stupid. They're gonna think it's stupid.
translation.de: Nein, sie wird es nicht mögen.

translation.en: How long you been here for?
They got me with a piece of pie and Lost Boys.
translation.de: Bei mir Kuchen und Lost Boys.

translation.en: Once upon a time, Alex stared up at the ceiling.
translation.de: Es war einmal ein Alex, der an die Decke starrte.

translation.en: Then the ceiling fell on him
and put him out of his misery.
It's the oldest book in here.
This thing's gotta be, like, a thousand years old.
translation.de: Es muss tausend Jahre alt sein.

translation.en: "If I don't make it out of here, I need someone to know what happened,
translation.de: "Jemand muss wissen, was passiert ist, wenn ich nicht rauskomme.

translation.en: even if it's only the characters in these books." "I saw a unicorn."
translation.de: Selbst wenn es nur die Buchfiguren sind. Ich sah ein Einhorn.

translation.en: "People said they didn't exist, but there it was."
"I followed it into this apartment, and now I'm trapped by a witch."
translation.de: Ich folgte ihm in diese Wohnung, und eine Hexe nahm mich gefangen.

translation.en: "I just have to do what the witch tells me to until Mom and Dad find me."
translation.de: Ich muss tun, was sie mir sagt, bis Mom und Dad mich finden.

translation.en: "There are other kids here. Most of them are nice."
"I'm scared, but at least I'm not alone."
translation.de: Ich habe Angst, bin aber nicht allein."

translation.en: Dinner in an hour. Hey, Yasmin,

translation.de: Ja, weil das zu mir passt.

translation.en: Oh, I thought maybe that's how she got you.
translation.de: Ich dachte, so hätte sie dich erwischt.

translation.en: You're right. It's none of my business.
And I bet you weren't lured in by a stupid movie and a piece of pie.
translation.de: Du wurdest sicher nicht von einem Film und Kuchen angelockt.

translation.en: What the hell is doro wat?
Chicken, onions caramelized in spiced butter, paprika, garlic,
translation.de: Hühnchen, karamellisierte Zwiebeln, Paprika, Knoblauch, Ingwer, Berbere.

translation.en: My āyatē… My grandmother and I used to make it before she died.
translation.de: Meine āyatē… Ich kochte es immer mit meiner Großmutter.

translation.en: We even grew all the herbs and veggies ourselves.
and I just so badly wanted to see my āyatē again.
translation.de: und ich wollte unbedingt meine āyatē wiedersehen.

translation.en: It was a witch, an evil, wicked witch.
translation.de: Sondern eine Hexe. Eine böse Hexe.

translation.en: How's that for a happy ending?
[Alex] "With the fangs came the hunger, and Katie discovered that her hunch was right."
translation.de: "Die Zähne machten sie hungrig, und Katie lag richtig.

translation.en: "To a vampire, blood does taste like candy."
translation.de: Für einen Vampir ist Blut eine Süßigkeit."

translation.en: Everybody knows it takes two days to grow full fangs.
translation.de: Reißzähne brauchen zwei Tage zum Wachsen.

translation.en: There's gotta be more writing from that Unicorn Girl.
translation.de: Da ist sicher noch mehr vom Einhorn-Mädchen.

translation.en: "…but it's too late. The roller coaster plunges down the drop."

translation.de: "…zu spät. Die Achterbahn stürzt ab. Stahl bricht, Metall kreischt…

translation.en: and the grim reaper's dog laughs at the carnage."
translation.de: und der Hund des Sensenmanns lacht."

translation.en: The grim reaper doesn't have a pet.
"They saw their son's footprints in the snow, leading into the woods."
translation.de: "Die Fußspuren ihres Sohns führten in den Wald.

translation.en: "Then they saw a pair of smaller footprints,
"And they never saw their precious son again."
translation.de: Sie sahen ihren Sohn nie wieder."

translation.en: Took me right out of the story.
Every good story hints at truth.
translation.de: Jede gute Geschichte deutet auf die Wahrheit hin.

translation.en: The more truth, the more powerful the story.
translation.de: Je wahrer, desto mächtiger die Geschichte.

translation.en: From now on, get your facts straight.
"I don't know how long I've been here." "I still have the necklace Mom and Dad gave me."
translation.de: "Ich weiß nicht, seit wann ich hier bin. Ich habe noch Moms und Dads Kette.

translation.en: "I used to touch it to remember them, but I stopped."
translation.de: Ich fasste sie an, um mich zu erinnern, aber ich habe aufgehört.

translation.en: "I have what I need to escape tonight."
"I'm finally going to see them again, Mom and Dad."
translation.de: Endlich sehe ich Mom und Dad wieder.

translation.en: "I wonder if they'll even know me." "Can people forget their kids?"
translation.de: Ob sie mich erkennen? Vergessen Eltern ihre Kinder?"

translation.en: You did not just throw a book at me!
Uh, no. You just surprised me. I dropped it.
Hey, Yasmin, wait until you see what I found.
translation.de: Warte, bis du siehst, was ich gefunden habe.

translation.en: This is Natacha's night nursery. Night nursery?
Yeah. Sunlight is bad for magical plants.
Enough questions. Help me with this.
I watered the vine with rat's blood instead of bat's blood.
translation.de: Da ich die Rebe mit Fledermausblut goss, wachsen Schredder-Eier darauf.

translation.en: Now, Shredder eggs are growing on it. If one of them hatches,
translation.de: Da ich die Rebe mit Fledermausblut goss, wachsen Schredder-Eier darauf. Wenn die den Garten zerstören, bringt Natacha mich um.

translation.en: it can destroy the night nursery, and Natacha will kill me.
translation.de: Wenn die den Garten zerstören, bringt Natacha mich um.

translation.en: -[Yasmin] I'm taking care of it, Lenore. -[meows]
[whispering] Okay. Put it gently on the ground.
translation.de: Okay. Leg es vorsichtig auf den Boden.

translation.en: Stomp it as hard as you can.
[Alex] Where's the blue mist come from? Do you make it?
translation.de: Wo kommt der blaue Nebel her?

translation.en: The mist, do you think it keeps Natacha young?
I mean, she's really pretty, but her books are ancient,
translation.de: Sie ist hübsch, aber ihre Bücher sind uralt

translation.en: and the apartment looks like a granny decorated it.
I thought for sure it was gonna--
It's cutting down the Shredder eggs! Stomp on them!
translation.de: Er schneidet die Eier ab! Zerstör sie!

translation.en: [Yasmin] There it is! Don't let it get away!
We need to find it and kill it before it destroys the whole place.
translation.de: Finden wir ihn, bevor er alles zerstört.

translation.en: I'm okay. I'm okay. I'm okay.
I don't know where it went. [breathes shakily]
Now let's get out of here.
You've been misbehaving in my garden.
This will hurt you far more than it hurts me. [chuckles]
translation.de: Das wird euch mehr wehtun als mir.

translation.en: [Natacha] And I would let you if I cared.
translation.de: Das könntest du, wenn es mich interessieren würde.

translation.en: Do try to keep your eyes open.
I would hate to have to start over.
translation.de: Ich will nicht noch mal anfangen.

translation.en: [distorted] Can't you do anything right? I said keep your eyes open!
translation.de: Bist du taub? Ich sagte: Augen auf!

translation.en: I begged Yasmin to take me to the nursery.
I thought the creepy plants might help me think of something cool to write about.
translation.de: Ich dachte, die Pflanzen inspirieren mich.

translation.en: She made me promise not to touch anything, but I did.
translation.de: Ich sollte nichts anfassen, aber ich tat es.

translation.en: That is very brave of you, Storyteller,
to lie right to my face.
translation.de: Mir so ins Gesicht zu lügen.

translation.en: If I didn't need you to clean up the mess, I would've.
I'm sorry I got you involved.
From now on, you help yourself. I'll help myself.
translation.de: Ab jetzt ist jeder auf sich allein gestellt.

translation.en: [spluttering] Yas, we can get out of here, together.
translation.de: Wir könnten zusammen von hier weg.

translation.en: Get… get off me! Get off me! Get off!
No! No! No! No! No! No! No!
-You've been here all night? -Yeah, all night. [sighs]
I made this. It'll help with the scrapes and cuts.
translation.de: Hier. Das hilft bei den Kratzern.
Du hast das für mich gemacht?

translation.en: It's a kind of aloe from a harpy plant, some dried corpse-hair vine.
Look what Yas made for us.
I… I… I don't have any stories. What do you mean you don't have any? You said you had a bunch of them.
translation.de: -Ich habe keine Geschichten. -Hattest du nicht jede Menge?

translation.en: I did, but a Shredder, it got into my room.
translation.de: Bis ein Schredder in mein Zimmer kam.

translation.en: And I killed it, but it destroyed all of my Nightbooks,
translation.de: Er ist tot, aber er zerstörte meine Nightbooks.

translation.en: I was reading to Natacha from those Nightbooks.
I've got nothing now. I… I have to escape. I have no choice!
translation.de: Jetzt habe ich nichts mehr. Ich muss fliehen.

translation.en: There are two ways out. The front door where you came in and the back door--
translation.de: Es gibt zwei Wege raus. Die Eingangs- und die Hintertür…

translation.en: The back door! It goes outside. I saw Natacha go through there. There's--
translation.de: Die führt nach draußen. Natacha ging durch.

translation.en: But Natacha's the only one that has the keys to that door.
translation.de: Nur sie hat den Schlüssel dafür.

translation.en: You need to get over this escape nonsense and write something.
-I'll be useless to her. She'll kill me. -She won't just kill you.
translation.de: Und mich umbringen. Nicht bloß das.

translation.en: Hwan was too young, but the rest of us took turns reading to Natacha.
translation.de: Hwan war zu jung, aber wir drei lasen vor.

translation.en: Afterwards, we'd all huddle together at night
Last night, I almost joined them.
One day, the kitchen sink got clogged.
That's because I blocked the pipe myself with starstell moss.
translation.de: Ich habe das Rohr mit Sternenmoos verstopft.

translation.en: [crying] I wanted to force Natacha to call the plumber.
I taped a note under the sink for him to find,
translation.de: Unter der Spüle klebte ein Zettel.

translation.en: Natacha found the note, didn't she?
Claire spent her last moments convincing Natacha that she did it…
translation.de: Claire überzeugte Natacha, dass sie es war…
Sie log, um mich zu retten.

translation.en: [breathes shakily] I used to love writing scary stories,
but then I decided to stop.
translation.de: aber dann hörte ich damit auf.

translation.en: And now that I have to write…
translation.de: Und jetzt, wo ich schreiben muss…

translation.en: the… the ideas won't come to me anymore.
[Yasmin] Yeah. A big, blue plastic one. Why?
-And Claire, those earrings? -[Yasmin] They were her aunt's.
translation.de: Und Claire diese Ohrringe? Von ihrer Tante.

translation.en: There's a way out of this place.
-"I have what I need to escape tonight." -"Escape," Yasmin.
"I'm finally gonna see them again, Mom and Dad."
translation.de: "Endlich sehe ich Mom und Dad wieder.

translation.en: "I wonder if they'll remember me." "Can people forget their kids?"
translation.de: Ob sie mich erkennen? Vergessen Eltern ihre Kinder?"

translation.en: Unicorn Girl never took this off,
and none of the kids in the cabinet are wearing it.
translation.de: Aber keines der Kinder im Schrank.

translation.en: You're right. And if she's not in the cabinet, then--
translation.de: Und wenn sie nicht im Schrank ist…
Genau. Sie entkam. Ich las ihre Notizen.

translation.en: I've been piecing together her notes. There are bits here and there.
translation.de: Sie entkam. Ich las ihre Notizen. Sie sind in Büchern versteckt, damit Natacha nichts…

translation.en: She hid them throughout the books, so in case Natacha found out--
translation.de: Sie sind in Büchern versteckt, damit Natacha nichts…

translation.en: She wouldn't know her full plan.
Your plan sucks. We're not gonna find this today.
You need to write a story for tonight.
It'd take, like, a thousand years to search all these books.
translation.de: Alle durchzugucken würde tausend Jahre dauern.

translation.en: The pen marks in the old book!

translation.de: Komm schon. Bitte sei hier drin.

translation.en: Is this the original "Hansel and Gretel"?
No one would just eat candy off of a strange house.
translation.de: Niemand isst Süßes von einem Haus.

translation.en: [gasps] I was right! More writing! [Yasmin] It's a recipe for a sleeping potion.
"I need to figure out how to hide the stink so she'll drink it."
"I'm so close. I'll put her to sleep and steal her keys."
translation.de: Wenn sie schläft, klaue ich die Schlüssel.

translation.en: "I'd turn her into a toad or a snail and laugh at her all day long."
translation.de: Ich würde sie in eine Kröte verwandeln und auslachen.

translation.en: "Then I would turn her into a centipede and rip off her legs." "All hundred legs,
translation.de: Dann in einen Tausendfüßler und ihr alle 1000 Füße ausreißen.

translation.en: I'll keep looking. You have to write a story.
You're the only one who can. You've gotta buy us more time.
translation.de: Du musst uns mehr Zeit verschaffen.

translation.en: I like to write scary stories?
Well, they're right. You are weird.
But the thing that makes you weird makes them ordinary.
translation.de: Aber was dich seltsam macht, macht sie normal.

translation.en: And no one likes to be ordinary. Ordinary sucks.
translation.de: Niemand ist gern normal. Das ist lahm.

translation.en: So ordinary people are gonna try and take that away from you…
translation.de: Normale Leute wollen dir das wegnehmen…

translation.en: How did she mask the smell? She must've found another ingredient.
translation.de: -Wie hat sie das gemacht? -Wohl mit noch einer Zutat.

translation.en: [Yasmin] The only other person who would know is Natacha, but she would never tell us.
translation.de: Natacha kennt sie sicher, aber sie würde es uns nie sagen.

translation.en: I could write a story to trick her into giving us the final ingredient of the sleeping potion.
translation.de: Ich könnte sie dazu bringen, uns die letzte Zutat zu sagen.

translation.en: [Yasmin] You know what happens if she figures out what we're up to?
translation.de: Du weißt, was passiert, wenn sie uns durchschaut.

translation.en: [Alex] I know what happens if we don't try. [Yasmin] What's the name of the story?
I want a story that'll make you squirm.
You thought I forgot about that, didn't you?
I was… I just… I was… [sighs]
I'm so sorry. I'm so stupid.
translation.de: Das war so dumm von mir.

translation.en: Yes, you are. I've only been saying that for years. Now you get it. [sighs heavily]
translation.de: Das sage ich schon seit Jahren. Endlich verstehst du es.

translation.en: You were about to tell me to start reading.
Oh yes. Well then, what are you waiting for?
[Alex] "For generations, the evil sorcerer of Quantel
sent children to mine jewels from the mouth of the great monster."
translation.de: schickte Kinder zum Juwelenabbau ins Maul des großen Biests."

translation.en: [Alex] "A thousand years ago, the evil sorcerer had a chance to kill the odious beast,
translation.de: "Der Magier hätte das abscheuliche Biest töten können,

translation.en: but instead he used a powerful potion to keep the monster unconscious,
translation.de: doch mit einem Trank hielt er es bewusstlos,

translation.en: [Alex] "Every morning, the sorcerer funneled his potion

translation.de: in das fünfte Ohr des Biests,

translation.en: "The recipe was as old as time."
"But the most important ingredient, however, was bindweed."
translation.de: Aber die wichtigste Zutat war Winde.

translation.en: "Bindweed was the only thing that could hide the powerful stench of the potion."
translation.de: Nur damit wurde der Gestank des Tranks überdeckt,

translation.en: "Without it, the rancid smell would rouse the great monster."
translation.de: der das große Biest sonst wecken würde.

translation.en: "But one day, the sorcerer went to harvest more bindweed,
translation.de: Doch als der Magier Winde ernten wollte,

translation.en: and he discovered that the entire field had withered and died."
translation.de: fand er das gesamte Feld zerstört vor.

translation.en: Oh, yes, yes, yes. Understood. It stinks.
[Alex] "The sorcerer would have to kill the great monster once and for all."
translation.de: "Der Magier müsste das große Biest ein für alle Mal töten.

translation.en: "He reluctantly raised his mighty staff to kill the beast,
translation.de: Doch als er widerwillig seinen Stab hob,

translation.en: but a peasant girl came to him and promised a solution to his problem."
translation.de: bot ihm ein Bauernmädchen eine Lösung an."

translation.en: I know a replacement for bindweed. Your jewel harvest can continue.
translation.de: Ich kenne einen Ersatz. Der Abbau kann weitergehen.

translation.en: Foolish child. You know nothing of real magic.
translation.de: Was weißt du schon von Magie?

translation.en: I can prove it. And if I do, I want a bag of jewels.
translation.de: Gib mir eine Tasche Juwelen, wenn ich es beweise.

translation.en: If it works, you will get two bags.
translation.de: Du kriegst zwei, wenn es klappt.

translation.en: If not, you will give me your life.
translation.de: Oder du gibst mir dein Leben.

translation.en: and poured a mysterious dark liquid into the jug."
translation.de: und kippte eine dunkle Flüssigkeit in den Krug.

translation.en: "The smell disappeared. The sorcerer couldn't believe it."
translation.de: Der Geruch war weg! Er war fassungslos.

translation.en: "It smelled like daisies, roses, lilacs on a spring morning--"
translation.de: Es roch nach Blumen an einem Frühlingsmorgen…"

translation.en: [Alex] "The evil sorcerer poured the potion into the monster's ear and waited."
translation.de: "Der Magier schüttete den Trank in das Ohr des Biests.

translation.en: "The beast let out a long… [in low voice] …grumble
"Yes! But the peasant girl had removed more than just the smell from the potion."
translation.de: Ja! "Doch das Mädchen entfernte nicht nur den Geruch.

translation.en: "She'd also erased all of its magic."
"The peasant girl nodded to something behind him."
translation.de: Das Mädchen nickte jemandem hinter ihm zu.

translation.en: [Alex] "The eyes of the great monster were open."
translation.de: Die Augen des Biests waren offen.

translation.en: [Alex] "The peasant girl watched it all, smiling."
"The evil sorcerer had sent her baby brother into that cave,
translation.de: Der Magier hatte ihren Bruder in die Minen geschickt,

translation.en: "The peasant girl cared nothing about jewels." "She got what she wanted, revenge."
translation.de: Ihr waren die Juwelen egal. Sie wollte nur Rache.

translation.en: "And so she walked away as the monster's sharp teeth chomped down on the shrieking sorcerer,
translation.de: Sie ging fort, während das Biest den Magier schnappte

translation.en: "Just as the peasant girl thought she'd gotten away with it all,
translation.de: Doch als sie dachte, sie wäre davongekommen,

translation.en: a black shadow loomed over her."
"It was the monster's giant foot, right above her."
translation.de: Der Fuß des Biests, direkt über ihr.

translation.en: Yeah, me and Yasmin researched for hours.
I know how important it is to get all the details right--

translation.de: -Wir wollten alles richtig machen, also… -Nein. Nein?

translation.en: Of course I made up the potion's ingredients,
but I was sure that bindweed hides odors.
translation.de: aber ich war sicher, Winde überdeckt Gerüche.

translation.en: -I really thought we got it right. -Well, there's your mistake.
translation.de: -Also lagen wir falsch? -Das war dein Fehler.

translation.en: Is that cinaroot with an "S" or a "C"?
Tonight, we're getting out of here.
It's turning green. I can't bring this out there.
translation.de: Es wird grün. Sie wird es merken.

translation.en: Maybe the acidity of the lemonade-- The service here is terrible. [sighs]
I don't have a story. We put two drops in the glass.
translation.de: -Ich habe nichts. -Mach noch zwei Tropfen in den Krug.

translation.en: -Let's put two in the pitcher. -Will it put her to sleep?
translation.de: -Ich habe nichts. -Mach noch zwei Tropfen in den Krug. Reicht das?

translation.en: What? I put it right here.
-Where is it? -What are you talking about?
Where is the potion? This has to happen.
Yeah, yeah. It's, uh… it's here somewhere.
So, um, this one is, um, called "The Cuckoo Clock."
[Alex] When Scott's parents bought the cuckoo clock at an estate sale,
translation.de: Als Scotts Eltern die Uhr kauften,

translation.en: he thought it was just another old-timey piece of junk.
translation.de: hielt er sie für ein Stück Schrott.

translation.en: But there was something strange about the clock.
Every hour on the hour, the little cuckoo would pop out,
translation.de: Zu jeder vollen Stunde kam ein kleiner Kuckuck raus,

translation.en: and, uh, Steve started to notice--
I thought you said his name was Scott.
So… so Scott noticed that, uh, the cuckoo seemed to look a little bit different every time it appeared.
translation.de: Scott bemerkte, dass der Kuckuck jedes Mal etwas anders aussah.

translation.en: Where are all your stories, the ones that you're supposed to be writing every day?
translation.de: Wo sind die Geschichten, die du jeden Tag schreiben sollst?

translation.en: -I'm sorry. I'm sorry. -Where are your new stories?
The Shredder, it got into my backpack.
[spluttering] Uh, it's true. It escaped from the night nursery.
translation.de: Ja, er ist aus dem Nachtgarten geflohen.

translation.en: I'll make you the recipe. I--
Please. You can barely follow a recipe.
translation.de: Also bitte, du kannst einem Rezept kaum folgen.

translation.en: He writes for you! You need him! [spluttering] I'll write the best story for you!
translation.de: -Du brauchst ihn! -Ich schreibe dir die beste Geschichte!

translation.en: [Alex] Oh no. What's wrong with you?
Poor little thing. What happened to you?
Lenore put our potion in the bottle of mist.
She must've gotten a dose of the sleeping potion.
How's that for following a recipe?
Wait. Where do you think it goes?
Never thought I'd see trees again.
translation.de: Dass ich noch mal Bäume sehe…

translation.en: I'm never gonna eat peanut butter ever again!
[Alex] You can forget about pumpkin pie for me!
First food when I get back? Vanilla milkshake!
translation.de: Als Erstes trinke ich einen Milchshake!

translation.en: Whoa, whoa, wait, Alex. Hold up. Hold up. Just wait a second.
The door, it wasn't the way out.

translation.de: Wir sind noch in der Wohnung.

translation.en: -[Alex] What just happened? -[Yasmin] Maybe something spooked it?

translation.de: "Jede gute Geschichte deutet auf die Wahrheit hin".

translation.en: -[voices echoing] -We're in "Hansel--" It smells so delicious.
We… we shouldn't be in here, Yas.

translation.de: Sieh mal einer an. Dornröschen ist aufgewacht.

translation.en: The mist, that's where it comes from.
who, by the way, does eat children.
We thought you were the original witch. We thought the blue mist kept you young.
translation.de: Bist du nicht die echte? Hält der Nebel dich nicht jung?

translation.en: I don't need the mist to keep me young. It gives me her magic.
translation.de: Dafür brauche ich keinen Nebel. Er gibt mir ihre Magie.

translation.en: I was about your age when she got me.
translation.de: Ich war so alt wie ihr, als sie mich schnappte.

translation.en: There were lots of us back then.
We knew not to get attached,
[Natacha] And then I… I had to clean the oven.
translation.de: Und ich musste den Ofen putzen.
Ich gab vor, sie zu mögen.

translation.en: Pretended to want to be like her.
translation.de: So sein zu wollen wie sie.

translation.en: But when I was alone, I plotted my escape.
translation.de: Aber wenn ich allein war, plante ich meine Flucht.

translation.en: I would get her to trust me.
[Natacha] I had nowhere else to go,
[Alex] She's the one who's been shaking the apartment?
[Natacha] If she doesn't get a story, we're all gonna die.
translation.de: Kriegt sie keine Geschichte, werden wir alle sterben.

translation.en: Stories of fear and suffering and death are like sweet lullabies to her.
translation.de: Geschichten über Angst und Tod sind ihre Schlaflieder.

translation.en: I don't have a story. Oh, yes, you do.
Tell us the reason that you wanted to destroy your Nightbooks.
translation.de: Warum wolltest du deine Nightbooks zerstören?

translation.en: All that pain and fear and sadness
translation.de: All der Schmerz, die Angst und die Traurigkeit, die du die ganze Zeit gemieden hast.

translation.en: that you've been avoiding this whole time.
translation.de: und die Traurigkeit, die du die ganze Zeit gemieden hast.

translation.en: You think I'm a bad witch?
Just wait until she wakes up and sees you.
So young, so plump, so juicy--
translation.de: So jung, so prall, so saftig.

translation.en: [Alex] There once was a boy who… who loved to write scary stories.
translation.de: Es war einmal ein Junge, der Gruselgeschichten schrieb.

translation.en: Every day, on his free time, he would come up with new ways to scare his classmates.
translation.de: Jeden Tag fand er neue Wege, seine Mitschüler zu erschrecken.

translation.en: But… [sighs] …they just didn't get his fascination with creepy things.
translation.de: Aber sie verstanden seine Faszination für Gruseliges nicht.

translation.en: To them, he was just… weird.
Alex finishes his latest bone-chilling tale,
translation.de: Alex beendete seine Geschichte und wollte sie teilen.

translation.en: and he's excited to share it.
translation.de: Alex beendete seine Geschichte und wollte sie teilen. ENDE?

translation.en: Hey, you're gonna love this one.
[Alex] Alex catches up with Josh after class.
translation.de: Alex spricht Josh nach der Stunde an.

translation.en: We turned the apartment into a haunted house.
It's amazing. I've got tons of new stories ready.
translation.de: Und ich habe jede Menge Geschichten.

translation.en: not wanting the others to hear.
Cody's having a gaming party. His dad's getting the truck and everything.
translation.de: Cody macht eine Spielparty. Sein Dad holt den Truck.

translation.en: Cody's my friend now too. And you're just not…
translation.de: Cody ist auch mein Freund. Und du bist…

translation.en: The way you dress, the things you like.
translation.de: Wie du dich anziehst, was du magst.

translation.en: "All you do is talk about your scary stories."
All right, all right. Alex, I'll see you later, okay?
The boy had written a new story about a haunted house.
translation.de: Der Junge schrieb über ein Spukhaus.

translation.en: [crying] He, his mom, and his dad
had turned his whole apartment into that house.
They made him hate the thing he loved most.
translation.de: Sie brachten ihn dazu, das zu hassen, was er am meisten liebte.

translation.en: And they made him hate himself.
The real truth is, he was embarrassed to be himself,
translation.de: Er schämte sich, er selbst zu sein.

translation.en: so he decided to burn his Nightbooks.
translation.de: Also wollte er seine Nightbooks verbrennen.

translation.en: He swore he'd never write another story again.
translation.de: Er schwor, nie wieder zu schreiben.

translation.en: The boy lost all his friends,
translation.de: Der Junge verlor alle seine Freunde.

translation.en: so he decided to destroy that part of himself
translation.de: Also wollte er den Teil von sich zerstören,

translation.en: She said she liked his stories.
But being captured by her was the best thing that ever happened to me…
translation.de: Doch gefangen zu sein, war das Beste, was mir je passierte.

translation.en: friends who love me for who I am, not for who they want me to be.
translation.de: die mich mögen, wie ich bin, nicht, wie sie mich wollen.

translation.en: What have you done? You stupid children.
translation.de: Was habt ihr getan? Ihr Dummköpfe.

translation.en: You've been asleep here so long, the… the candy is infecting you.
translation.de: Durch das lange Schlafen hat dich das Süße infiziert.

translation.en: I have lived in fear of you for so long, but I am not that little girl anymore.
translation.de: Ich hatte so lange Angst vor dir. Ich bin kein Mädchen mehr.

translation.en: Help! We need help! Get us out of here!
translation.de: Hilfe! Hilfe! Holt uns hier raus!

translation.en: A witch is gonna eat us!
[Yasmin] Alex, move. I've seen Natacha do this.
translation.de: Weg da. Natacha hat das mal gemacht.
Ich bin zu Hause. Gehen wir.

translation.en: We're still in my building. The apartment didn't move.
translation.de: Das ist immer noch mein Haus.

translation.en: -Do you have a plan? -Not exactly a plan, an idea.
This is the worst elevator ever!
We just need to make it to that boiler room.
-No! No! No! No! -No! No! No! No!
No, let… let her go. It's me you want.
translation.de: Lass sie gehen. Du willst mich.

translation.en: "Stories about fear and death are like lullabies to her." [Yasmin] No, no, no.
translation.de: "Geschichten über Angst und Tod sind ihre Schlaflieder."

translation.en: You like stories? I got stories.
[breathes shakily] Jason couldn't decide which was stranger.
The fact that his sister died every Tuesday at 11:15
translation.de: Dass Jasons Schwester jeden Dienstag um 11:15 Uhr starb,

translation.en: or that she always came back to life 20 minutes later.
translation.de: oder dass sie 20 min später wieder lebte?

translation.en: Zachary had always thought that clowns were the scariest part of the circus.
translation.de: Zachary fand Clowns immer am gruseligsten im Zirkus.

translation.en: I found a package on my front porch
addressed to the woman standing right behind you.
translation.de: das an die Frau hinter dir adressiert ist.

translation.en: -The stories! -[Alex] Push her! Push her in!
-[Yasmin] Keep it shut! -[Alex] Keep her in!
So that's why they call you a tryhard?
We didn't forget about you. Come here.
[Yasmin] Maybe we should take the stairs.
[Alex] These are my friends, Lenore and Yasmin.
♪ Thou shall not die ♪ ♪ Unchain me, sister! ♪
translation.de: VERMISSTES MÄDCHEN NACH DREI JAHREN ZURÜCK

translation.en: My parents drove me up to surprise you.
-What is that? Like, your third story? -Fourth, actually.
So you could definitely use this.
[Yasmin] Check out the flowers. My next science fair project.
The effect of ultraviolet black light on photosynthetic organisms.
[Alex] Still don't believe in happy endings? [Yasmin] I'm starting to.
translation.de: -Immer noch kein Fan von Happy Ends? -So langsam.
